<p align="center">
    <b>Registrador e manipulador de pacotes para Habbo rico em recursos para Windows, Linux e Mac.</b>
</p>

## ‚ö°Ô∏è Come√ßando

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

### ‚òùÔ∏è Requisitos

Este projeto roda com Java + JavaFX. Se voc√™ s√≥ est√° planejando rodar o G-Earth e suas extens√µes nativas, voc√™ s√≥ vai precisar da vers√£o JRE, mas se voc√™ estiver interessado em desenvolver extens√µes, voc√™ poder√° precisar da vers√£o JDK para extens√µes nativas, mas h√° [outros frameworks](#frameworks).

Voc√™ pode baixar as vers√µes JRE e JDK que v√™m com JavaFX a partir da [p√°gina de downloads da Oracle](https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/downloads/#java8).

> üîî **Por favor note**: o Java 8 √© o mais est√°vel e compat√≠vel com G-Earth, futuras vers√µes do Java n√£o v√™m com JavaFX e n√≥s n√£o iremos ajudar com instala√ß√µes de novas vers√µes.

### ‚úÖ Instala√ß√£o

1. V√° para a p√°gina de lan√ßamento mais recente [aqui](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Earth/releases/latest);
1. Procure pela vers√£o espec√≠fica do seu SO na se√ß√£o de anexos e baixe ela;
1. Extraia o arquivo para uma nova pasta.

> üîî Se voc√™ est√° jogando no cliente baseado em navegador, voc√™ precisa instalar a [extens√£o G-Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/g-chrome/cdjgbghobmfmfcenhoahgfnfpcadddag) para fazer ele funcionar com G-Earth.

> üîî **Para usu√°rios Mac**: siga o [guia de instala√ß√£o MacOs](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Earth/wiki/macOs-Installation-guide) (apenas flash).

### üèÉ Rodando

Rode o `G-Earth` **execut√°vel** e deve pedir por permiss√µes de administrador, caso contr√°rio voc√™ precisa clicar com o bot√£o direito nele e selecionar para executar como administrador. Clicar duas vezes no arquivo `.jar` pode funcionar tamb√©m.

Voc√™ pode rodar o arquivo `G-Earth.jar` com `java -jar G-Earth.jar` em um terminal habilitado para administradores. Se voc√™ incluir o par√¢metro `t`, os pacotes ir√£o ser exibidos no seu terminal.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Funcionalidades

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

* Detecta automaticamente o hotel
* Suporte a retros - entre com o host & porta manualmente (apenas na primeira vez)
* Registra pacotes saindo e entrando
  * Existem tr√™s representa√ß√µes de pacotes: legada, estrutura/express√£o (predi√ß√£o) e hexa;
* Injete, bloqueie & substitua pacotes em tempo real
* Agendador avan√ßado
* Suporte avan√ßado para extens√µes
* Programa√ß√£o com Python em tempo real
* Proxy com SOCKS
* Identifica pacotes atrav√©s de [Harble API](https://api.harble.net/messages/) e [sulek.dev](https://www.sulek.dev)
* Suporta ambos Unity (navegador) e Flash

### üåê Conex√£o

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

TODO (screenshot)

A aba *Conex√£o* √© onde voc√™ conecta o G-Earth com o cliente Habbo. Se voc√™ sempre utiliza o cliente Flash/Air, s√≥ clique no bot√£o *Conectar*, ele ir√° mudar para *Abortar* e o *Estado de conex√£o* vai mudar para *Esperando conex√£o*. Depois disso voc√™ entra no hotel e √© isso!

Voc√™ pode ler mais sobre isso na Wiki (TODO).

### üíâ Inje√ß√£o

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

TODO (screenshot)

Na aba *Inje√ß√£o* voc√™ tem acesso f√°cil para enviar pacote manualmente, para o servidor ou para o cliente. Se voc√™ enviar para o servidor √© a igual se estivesse fazendo alguma a√ß√£o no jogo (como andando para algum lugar), ent√£o todos podem ver o que voc√™ est√° fazendo. No outro sentido, se voc√™ enviar para o cliente, s√≥ ir√° afetar o seu jogo (como removendo/colocando algum item no quarto).

Voc√™ pode ler mais sobre isso na Wiki (TODO).

### üõ†Ô∏è Tools

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

TODO (screenshot)

In the *Tools* tab you will se two sections, *Encoding/Decoding* and *Packet <-> expression*. These converters are usefull if you are manipulating the packets by hand. They don't have effect on the current packets that are beeing send or receiving.

This is an advanced subject, so to understand more about this things, read in the Wiki (TODO).

### ‚è≤Ô∏è Scheduler

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

TODO (screenshot)

In the *Scheduler* you can send any packets repeatedly, with specific interval+offset for each packet. After you have done, you can save the list to an file and load that configuration aftwards.

Read more about it in the Wiki (TODO).

### üß© Extensions

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

TODO (screenshot)

The most powerfull tab, the *Extension* tab allows you to connect multiple custom extensions that anyone can create and share. These extensions have full access to the packets, so it can do things from replace everybody's avatar (see [MackleEverywhere](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Earth-template-extensions/tree/master/MackleEverywhere)) to a full room+wired save and replace (see [Wired Presets](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/Wired-Presets)).

The most commom extensions uses the native frameworkd, as it doesn't required further installations from who will use it. These extensions are a single `.jar` file, so you just need to click in the *Install* button and select that file.

Since v1.5, you can install awesome extension from the [G-ExtensionStore](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-ExtensionStore#readme). It has the most updated extensions from a one click away. We try to keep it malicious-free, not be aimed at disturbing the game and all of them are open-source.

You can read more details about extensions in the Wiki (TODO).

#### Frameworks

Aside from the native framework, there some are others that let you create your own extension and communicate with G-Earth:

Name | Language | Developers | Github
--- | --- | --- | --- |
G-Earth (Native) | Java | sirjonasxx | https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Earth
G-Python<sup>1</sup> | Python | sirjonasxx | https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Python
Geode | C# & Visual Basic | ArachisH, LilithRainbows | https://github.com/LilithRainbows/Geode
Xabbo | C# | b7 | https://github.com/b7c/Xabbo.Scripter
G-Node | Node.js | WiredSpast | https://github.com/WiredSpast/G-Node
GProgrammer<sup>2</sup> | Javascript | at15four2020 | https://github.com/at15four2020/GProgrammer/wiki

<sub>1: built-in in G-Earth through the [live scripting console](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Earth/wiki/G-Python-qtConsole) </sub>  
<sub>2: not an implementation of the extension API, but allows for Javascript scripting, also check [G-Wiredfy](https://github.com/at15four2020/G-Wiredfy) </sub>

> üîî **Please note**: if you received some extension from those frameworks, please follow the installation guide specific to that framework. You have to setup your environment only once.

You can read more advanced info about the frameworks in the Wiki (TODO).

### ‚ûï Extra

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

In the *Extra* tab you have some utilities and settings. Some things you can do:

- *Notepad*: save anything usefull you want;
- *Always on top*: fixes the G-Earth window on top of the others;
- *Client-side staff permissions*: the client thinks that you are an staff and shows you more buttons, like mute people, move anything anywhere, etc (it's only client-side so most of it doesn't work when you try to use);
- *G-Python scripting*: enables the *G-Python shell* button in the *Extensions* tab (read more in [G Python qtConsole](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Earth/wiki/G-Python-qtConsole))
- *Advanced*:
  - *Use SOCKS proxy*;
  - *Disable decryption*
  - *Debug to stdout*

## Others

[(Voltar ao topo)](#logo)

### G-Mem

G-Earth uses [G-Mem](https://github.com/sirjonasxx/G-Mem) as memorysearcher that extracts the RC4 table.
